abstract: Schools Chancellor Dennis M. Walcott defended the job reductions, but some council members were not convinced that the action was necessary.
snippet: Schools Chancellor Dennis M. Walcott defended the job reductions, but some council members were not convinced that the action was necessary.
lead_paragraph: At an often heated hearing before the City Council on Tuesday, Schools Chancellor Dennis M. Walcott defended the administration's decision to lay off 672 school support workers last week and said that officials had warned of the layoffs in June. City Council members - some of whom argued that counting the city's share of unemployment-benefit and food-stamp costs, the savings from the layoffs would be insignificant - were unconvinced that they were necessary. headline.main: Council Debate on School Layoffs Grows Heated
